alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:18PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washakie County through 445 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Ten Sleep, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ten Sleep around 435 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tensleep Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; Southeast Big Horn Basin
